candidates.title: Pinocchio Feature
candidates.body:
With this Delegation Program become available for those that want to develop in Pinocchio.

Some considerations:
- Due to the use of Vecs, no_allocator! in the Pinocchio entrypoint is not allowed
- The code should be improved to avoid Vecs and clone in order to follow Pinocchio principles by using zero copy and avoid heap allocations.
- In this code I implemented a custom serialization to avoid Borsh but we can easily revert back to borsh.
- All the instructions are in the instruction folder but I can store them as per SDK example
- All instructions and helpers have been updated to use Pinocchio structs and implementations

Let me know what changes you want to see and I shall do them but this is pretty much an re-implementation of the SDK to Pinocchio.

candidates.title: Implementation of dynamic routing table
candidates.body: Now, in addition to user provided routing table (which is now optional) the resolver will attempt to fetch all node records from domain registry and maintain an up to date list of those records, so the routing table can be changed on the fly when if nodes connect or disconnect from network.

candidates.title: Remove upper bound constraint for solana and anchor dependency
candidates.body: Remove upper bound constraint for solana and anchor dependency with the new release of anchor 0.31.0 which allows the usage of solana program 2 and above.

candidates.body: ## feat: use range for Solana dependency

candidates.title: chore: remove v2 from crate name
feat: add magic-resolver to rust workspace
chore: remove valid_until
candidates.body:
## Summary

Removing the valid_until parameter to the delegation record and delegation IX.

## Details

This used to be an attack vector, removed in PR: https://github.com/magicblock-labs/delegation-program/pull/55

candidates.title: Restructure the project based on the implementation language
candidates.body: As we are planning to expand the SDK, it's reasonable to alter the structure of repository, to make it easier to navigate. This PR segregates the codebase depending on implementation language, and changes the structure of rust workspace to make it more idiomatic.

candidates.title: feat: update delegation dependency and simplify usage
candidates.body:
## feat: update delegation dependency and simplify usage

- Update delegation program dependency
- Simplify usage and delegation API
- Introduced Anchor helpers

## Notes

- Since this is a breaking version and the delegation program has not yet been deployed, the crate is temporarily published at `ephemeral-rollups-sdk-v2`

- Similarly, the ts sdk is published at `@magicblock-labs/ephemeral-rollups-sdk-v2`

## Issues

Closes #6

## Description

- Add magic context to `commit` and `commit_and_undelegate` CPIs, which is used to store the context and avoid race conditions
